title: Home Depot stock jumps after big earnings beat, surprise same-store sales growth
text: Shares of Home Depot Inc. HD, -0.01% shot up 4.6% in premarket trading Tuesday, after the home improvement retailer reported fiscal first-quarter earnings that rose above expectations, surprise growth in same-store sales and raised its full-year outlook. Net income for the quarter to May 1 rose to $4.23 billion, or $4.09 a share, from $4.15 billion, or $3.86 a share, in the year-ago period.

title: Home builder stocks suffer unanimous selloff after disappointing new home sales data
text: The home builder sector was suffering a unanimous selloff in morning trading Tuesday, after data showing new home sales surprisingly fell in April, and sharply, amid high prices, rising mortgage rates and low supply. The iShares U.S. Home Construction ETF ITB, -3.76% sank 3.4%, with all 47 equity components losing ground, while the SPDR S&P Homebuilders ETF XHB, -3.67% dove 3.4% with all 35 components falling, to underperform the S&P 500's SPX, -2.09% 2.1% slide.
